name: TheAtlantic
text:
Stanford University has announced that it will drop 11 varsity sports, including fencing, sailing and squash.

Athletics at elite colleges "are a quiet sort of affirmative action for affluent white kids," Saahil Desai argued in 2018: https://t.co/Zt0RpSNmlV

name: TheAtlantic
text: Earth at night is a navy-blue marble with a dusting of gold, the electric sparks of modern life. When the pandemic arrived, researchers started seeing intriguing changes in the glow, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/drsoBtj87T

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I always feel like I'm never doing enough." America's public-health experts are tired, drained, and frustrated about shouting advice into a political void, @edyong209 reports. https://t.co/PBkFtmnozH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The backlash against a successful government program is why the U.S. can‚Äôt have nice things." @GrahamDavidA looks at criticism of the Paycheck Protection Program: https://t.co/a7dcuCbYAl

name: TheAtlantic
text: The United States is breaking coronavirus-case records weekly. Americans should avoid faulting the wrong people, our writers warn. From @mimbsy: https://t.co/yEtmbFBG5L

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In recent weeks, the protests over the killing of George Floyd have provoked an unusually wide-ranging debate about how to respond to police violence. Earmark funds for reform? Defund the police? Abolish them?" @conor64 writes: https://t.co/nMoT6d3WBQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: It‚Äôs hardly a stretch to say that hundreds of millions, perhaps billions, of wild animals will ultimately be spared from becoming roadkill because of coronavirus lockdowns, @ben_a_goldfarb reports: https://t.co/9fTFJElclA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Calls for police reform continue. What‚Äôs the best way forward for American policing? Four writers share their thoughts in the latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/CVQrk4AU6w

name: TheAtlantic
text: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi offers a case study for how nationalist leaders can back down from confrontation while still saving face, writes @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/oeWv7qiQZd

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pop Smoke‚Äôs posthumous debut album soundtracks the unthinkable‚Äîa New York summer without rowdy social gatherings, and a rap landscape without the late musician, @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/d0qM0Z30LE

name: TheAtlantic
text: In her latest novel, Ottessa Moshfegh chronicles the wild things women are pushed to do in the face of emptiness. @_StefHayes on ‚ÄúDeath in Her Hands‚Äù: https://t.co/tjeufPyZiZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Four more years of Donald Trump might present tantalizing opportunities for Beijing to expand its influence around East Asia and the world. @MichaelSchuman looks at why China wouldn't mind a Trump win in November: https://t.co/IxBrNfxYi3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Millions of kids don‚Äôt know when they‚Äôll set foot in a classroom again. Today, we look at the politics of school reopening in America. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/m6S6qpzayI

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: What happens when France's universalist ideals run up against the day-to-day reality of racism in France? https://t.co/vmskYpaKp3

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: An eight-step, evidence-based plan for reopening schools this fall, from @DrTomFrieden, @arneduncan, and @MargaretEdu: https://t.co/6XHqhp1P5i

name: TheAtlantic
text: What does the surge in cases in the south and west mean for the country‚Äôs chances of containing the pandemic? Staff writer @alexismadrigal explains. https://t.co/XVjc1lDdc1

name: TheAtlantic
text: France's prestigious¬†"grandes √©coles"¬†illustrate the gulf between its universal ideals and its day-to-day life. The country is officially color-blind but, as @RachelDonadio writes, reality is not. https://t.co/V00v5GJjZx

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: An important piece on fighting AIDS‚Äîand racism‚Äîfrom a first-time @TheAtlantic author, who‚Äôs been active in both fights for decades: https://t.co/YN7tbdNgNX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is one of the best pieces I've read about how we get from here to there. ("There" is still extremely complicated, however.) https://t.co/cs9ACoPcZT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The single most important thing we can do to keep our schools safe has nothing to do with what happens in schools. It's how well communities control the coronavirus throughout the community," @DrTomFrieden, @arneduncan, and @MargaretEdu write: https://t.co/T9XP4EYxZt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: it‚Äôs been really interesting to me to try to imagine how history books will write about this time (will they remember the fireworks detail?)‚Äîso I loved working with an actual history textbook author on this ‚Äúfirst draft‚Äù of a chapter on 2020: 
https://t.co/kQxEPzM1IX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @davidfrum: In advance of the Trump business documents decision expected this AM from the Supreme Court: here's a primer by me from March about the legal rights-and-wrongs of the case. https://t.co/865Uwr7ZD0

name: TheAtlantic
text: How will history textbooks remember the year 2020? James West Davidson, a historian and a textbook author, writes a first draft of what high-school students might read one day: https://t.co/TBsQo7uHkb

name: TheAtlantic
text: Geoffrey Berman, a federal prosecutor whom Trump abruptly fired, will testify before the House Judiciary Committee today. @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes examine theories for his dismissal: patronage, retaliation, and interference with an investigation. https://t.co/4j8aJ7SoSg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When President Trump and others point exclusively to lagging death figures during a surge, they are trying to tell you that America is, secretly, winning the war on COVID-19. But we‚Äôre not," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/3F01h9hb1T

name: TheAtlantic
text:
The Supreme Court has ruled that much of eastern Oklahoma is tribal land.

Many feared that, under such a decision, decades of state criminal convictions could be reopened and possibly thrown out. In May, @rebeccanagle argued that wasn‚Äôt a realistic fear. https://t.co/D0tE3LfiZG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump is betting the Republican Party's future on resurrecting a past that is dissolving before his eyes, @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/iM7rUD1wXX

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I hope we can destroy this narrative that women don't love action [and] that women don't want to shoot action." The director Gina Prince-Bythewood spoke with @davidlsims about making the best action movie of the year so far, Netflix's "The Old Guard." https://t.co/TrjfAd75GN

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In theory, rule of law stands. In practice, where it stands is outside the door, rapping fiercely but fruitlessly to come in." @GrahamDavidA argues that the president is successfully running out the clock: https://t.co/9vxr10PAPe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump's legal¬†strategy¬†was cannier than his legal arguments. The strategy was to play for time, to push the day of reckoning beyond November 2020. That strategy has now paid¬†off," @davidfrum writes: https://t.co/AAk8hbQTQ1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As America continues its long-overdue reckoning with racism and systemic injustice, we must address the devastating impact of [HIV/AIDS] on the Black community," @eltonofficial writes: https://t.co/unZRltXiQ4

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic isn't nearly over and many parents' careers‚Äîparticularly mothers' careers‚Äîare already suffering, writes @jpinsk: https://t.co/PcvVPXbG87

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We‚Äôre still far from widespread GOP abandonment of the president‚Äîbut if that does happen, this is how one might expect it to begin: with the most bulletproof and most endangered politicians at the vanguard," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/LWgxd0NLjf

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The problem isn‚Äôt that policy makers‚Äîmany of them parents too‚Äîdon‚Äôt know what families are going through," @juliettekayyem writes. "It‚Äôs that, fundamentally, the way public officials thought about the consequences of this crisis was flawed." https://t.co/fvtqlzjbbO

name: TheAtlantic
text: What accounts for the level of anger directed at J. K. Rowling over her views on gender? Her Millennial fans are discovering that her values are not the same as theirs, @HelenLewis writes: https://t.co/XLOZ1B9P1w
